result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Caleb T. Smith

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on November 28, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Judgment for Bond Forfeiture - $2,500.00
Proposed Order for Judgment of Bail/Bond Forfeiture

(Case called at 11:13 AM)
Defendant Caleb Smith appears in custody from Burnett County Jail without counsel.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Warrant executed.  State requests current $2,500 cash bond be forfeited and that a new $10,000 cash bond be set - so ordered.
Return Hearing: 11/23/2022 at 9:30 AM

Conditions:
No contact with J.B., J.B.'s residence, J.B.'s place of employment.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
No use or possession of weapons.

9:49 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney George E. Miller in court for Caleb T. Smith. Defendant Caleb T. Smith not in court. Attorney Miller has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. State requests warrant. 

Warrant ordered.

10:03 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Caleb T. Smith in court with Attorney George E. Miller.
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on September 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on July 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 10:00 AM) Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Caleb T. Smith not in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Caleb T. Smith. 
No information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. Bailiff indicates he is in custody. 
Hearing: 07/21/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Case called at 9:48 AM.
Prosecuting Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Caleb T. Smith in court with Attorney George E. Miller. 
Attorney Miller requests an adjournment.
Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with J.B., J.B.'s residence, J.B.'s place of employment.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
No use or possession of weapons.

(Case called at 11:06- by Zoom) Defendant Caleb Smith appears in custody via video conference from the Jail. Attorney George Miller appears separately by video. ADA Kelly Ronquist appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense's Motion to Modify Bond. Defense makes argument for signature bond or lower cash bond.  State objects- recites failures to appear and makes argument. 
Court orders cash bond modified to $2,500 cash bond with previous conditions.
Hearing on April 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with J.B., J.B.'s residence, J.B.'s place of employment.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
No use or possession of weapons.
Bail/bond hearing on March 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

(9:33 AM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Caleb T. Smith appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney George E. Miller for Caleb T. Smith appeared by video. 
State notes Attorney Miller was just appointed and were unable to move the hearing due to victim notification.
Attorney Miller is requesting to address bond modification but hasn't filed a motion yet.
Court advises Attorney Miller is to file the motion and schedule a motion hearing with the Branch 2 Judicial Assistant.
Adding additional language to the probable cause section.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney George Miller at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $35 beginning 03/18/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.
Proposed Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Hearing on March 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 11:15 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Caleb Smith appeared in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier. Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the Complaint. Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation. State requests $5,000 cash bond. Defense requests signature bond- Defendant is on PO hold. Court orders $5,000 cash bond with various conditions. Time limits for a preliminary hearing are waived. 
Pre-Trial Conference: 02/14/2022 at 2:00 PM.  Hearing: 03/09/2022 at 9:30 AM.  
Court orders clerk to send copy of county appointed attorney paperwork to Defendant.

Conditions:
No contact with J.B., J.B.'s residence, J.B.'s place of employment.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
No use or possession of weapons.
ECC Pretrial Report
